reviews.content:
I received my bike within 4 working days of shipment notice. The unboxing was clean & no damage was present. Assembly was easy & I was soon ready to jump on & try it. The Wahoo app did a nice job of capturing my existing road bike to suggest settings for the fit of the Kickr Bike. The bike worked without issue & was ready to connect to my chosen cycling app. Once I resolved some connection issues on the cycling app side of things, the bike now connects quickly and so far with no problems. 

The bike itself is much more solid than I expected. It's got a good feel to it & enough give in the right ways to feel like you're riding outdoors. Once I got connected into the cycling app, I was amazed at the feel as the bike raises & lowers as the terrain goes by. You really can feel the road dips/raises & while you can't steer (yet), your body will lean like you can. One of the features I really like is the ability to select your own cassettes. Not only are some standard cassettes available but you can customize any cassette you like & change it on the fly with the Wahoo app. Very handy for tough virtual climbs. The shifters work nicely & while the gear display is not in the easiest place to see, it's not terrible either. Not sure where else I'd put it that would be out of the way of your hands and sweat drops.

All in all, while the bike is on the high end of the cost spectrum, it really is nice to be able to just jump on and go. It's a solid piece of equipment and the incline/decline features give it a real world feel. I've ridden it everyday since I got it so that should tell you a little something. I'm happy with my purchase & glad I opted for the high end for the extra 'bells and whistles'. It's only been a week so we'll see how it's longevity fairs over time.
reviews.title: Enjoying my new Kickr Bike

reviews.content: I love this bike. I have had a smart trainer for years and wanted something I could get on and go without having to mount my bike on the trainer. My husband also uses the trainer, so we were constantly swapping out bikes. I looked at Peloton (not really my jam), Nordic Track and Schwinn, among others. Then I came upon the Kickr bike and it had everything I was looking for. Integrates seamlessly with Sufferfest and Zwift, rides like a dream, and is a quality build. Easy to switch between riders as well. Money well spent.
reviews.title: Worth the price.

reviews.content: Love this trainer bike and it's helping with Zwift and staying at home. One issue that I'm having is that the "drop" between the saddle and bars is too much so I'll be looking for a way to raise the bars. I also love the "climb mode". It seems like a crazy amount to spend on a trainer bike but when you consider the cost of a road bike along with the amount of time I spend on this its completely worth it!
reviews.title: Surviving CV crisis with the Kickr Bike / Zwift

reviews.content: Ordered the bike from the U.K. and despite the coronavirus situation it was delivered within 3 working days, which I thought was remarkable. The install and setup of the bike was very straight forward using the app. I joined Zwift and got the bike connected with no issues at all. At first I did not seem to get the uphill/downhill working but looking in YouTube I found the setting I was missing. Me and my wife have now been using the bike for a week and we love it! My only compliant thus far is that the bike rattles on the floor if you really pound it even if we are on the lower scale weight wise (58kg & 65kg). I previously owned a kettler racer s bike and base/legs just didn't move/rattle no matter what. I have the bike sit on 1.9cm rubber Gym flooring, which I am hoping won't get damaged. Other than although certainly pricey this it is a great purchase providing Wahoo continue to offer software support and updates over the years to come (don't pull a Sonos style policy or you'll lose customer loyalty!) to keep the bike compatible with the major virtual cycling apps such as Zwift. Thanks Wahoo for listening.
reviews.title: Happy with purchase so far

reviews.content:
The bike was delivered much faster than promised. Setup was easy. The bike is quiet and smooth... so quiet, in fact, that you might wonder if the tilt is working. If it's unlocked, it is!

I swapped out the handlebars, seat, and pedals and it now has a great feel comparable to my road bike. Not only that, but now I can tweak my setup, try different things easily, and then adjust my road bike to match my Kickr bike. 

Some reviewers report thigh contact with the top tube that's 2 1/4" wide. I taped down a cardboard strip that wide to my road bike and saw it wouldn't be a problem. Sure enough, I have no problems with that on the Kickr bike.

I do occasionally touch the inside heel of my right foot with a flare near the right chainstay on the Kickr bike. I use speedplay pedals and unconsciously use quite a bit of the resulting float. It's not a big deal, just occasionally a annoying.

So the bottom line is that I'm really glad to have the Kickr bike and don't regret the significant investment in it. It's definitely quieter, smoother, more flexible, and more responsible than the excellent Kickr/Climb setup I had been using for over a year.
reviews.title: A Step Up from the Kickr/Climb

So far I'm stunned at how quiet the bike is - as much aural footprint as a fan in the background (no annoying clicks or squeaks like I have with my old bike mounted trainer). Combined with Zwift it certainly feels like I'm entering an exciting new training period.

I'm looking forward to the coming miles (once I change that saddle!).

reviews.content: I upgraded to the KICKR Bike after using the top-of-the-line KICKR Smart Trainer for approximately 18 months. As good as it already was, I have zero regrets! The setup was easy and intuitive with the Wahoo App, it connects quickly via bluetooth, it is very quiet, the power and wattage are accurate, and you can really customize the shifters. The shifting is super smooth and if you have the settings down correctly, it will incline and decline as the virtual terrain varies. Most importantly, the construction and sturdiness of the KICKR Bike is evident; it does not wobble and you can get in and out of the saddle without worrying about torquing the frame or construct. Another amazing Wahoo product!
reviews.title: HIGHLY recommend the KICKR Bike

reviews.content:
I have logged a dozen or so rides now on the Wahoo Bike. Because of weather and schedule demands I log more than half of my total miles and 2/3 of my rides a year on the trainer and Zwift. 
The great: whomever designed the software-based shifting and ride quality deserves a gold star. It really replicates the feel of shifting and accuracy of gearing with my outdoor bike. And I love that I don't have to worry about a chain, or a derailleur getting out of adjustment etc. It is truly exceptional in this area. Overall it is a much better experience than a classic direct drive smart trainer with a standard bike, and I thought that experience was already good. Setup was quite easy. I used the output from my Guru fit and it felt just like my outside bike with exception that for some reason the saddle height was at least 2 inches off but easy enough to adjust. 
The not-so-great: With a price tag of $3,500, one would think that Wahoo would include something better than a $5 saddle. The bar and bar-tape are not much better. My assumption is they assume everyone will want their own saddle choice and bar/bar-tape. It is almost as if they went to vendors and said we just need to put something on the bike, so give us the cheapest you have regardless of function. For many people what is shipped would have worked if it was of any level of quality and it just adds cost to the overall package having to replace. And it cheapens an otherwise great solution.
The not expected: I like the climb feature, particularly on long climbs. However, when riding a Zwift course with a lot of rollers like Sand and Sequoias, it is almost motion sickness inducing. My solution was merely to put the climb lock on when in a section of significant rollers. It might just be me and something I need to get used it.
A word on financials: Yes $3500 is a lot of money. Yes, it is a luxury. But my backup bike got destroyed and I am not a fan of moving my main bike on and off the trainer as I think it causes undo wear and tear on the bike. If you combine the cost of a decent bike for a trainer, and a decent direct drive smart trainer, and then throw in that you can have multiple users ride it because it is adjustable, I think it made sense for me, even if the experience was equal to a typical direct drive trainer. But the reality is it is a much better experience.
reviews.title: Exceptional, but with room for improvement.

reviews.content: Excellent product. Seems very well-built. Quiet—much quieter than my previous indoor setup. With Zwift, it provides an excellent VR simulation of outdoor group and individual riding. My career and work hours limit opportunities for outdoor riding which I prefer, but this is a very close and satisfying simulation. More expensive than other options, but I'm extremely pleased and enjoying wonderful return on investment. Strongly recommend.
reviews.title: Great VR experience and ROI.

reviews.content: We've had the KICKR Bike for 2 months now and it has changes the way we train, group ride, and race on Zwift. With the quiet operation, seamless shifting, and quick user change capabilities we have seen our progress pick-up immensely. Being a 2-bike household there is no more swapping bikes once or twice a day. I also find that I push harder on both uphill and downhill grades knowing how quickly I can ratchet through the gears without listening to cassettes grinding. It has made even the hardest workout or race fun again.
reviews.title: Next Level Indoor Cycling ...

reviews.content:
I'm a serious cyclist with a very busy professional work and family schedule. So heavily rely on indoor training for sanity, fitness, and efficiency. I had a 2016 Kickr that I logged close to 'miles on last year and the year before. Although that is a great product, the Kickr Bike is simply a leap forward in terms of noise (it is practically silent), ride feel, and integration with training apps. 

I use trainer road and was a bit confused at first because you don't need to calibrate the Kickr Bike. This made me incredulous that it would be accurate, but it absolutely is.
reviews.title: Incredible technology!

reviews.content: Unbelievably real ride experience. Customizable to your normal ride. Quiet and stable
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.content:
I have had my KICKR bike for 10 days now and have ridden around 21 hours, or 380 miles on Zwift. I really, really like it. It wasn't cheap, but at this point I would say it's worth every penny. 

It was a bit of a pain to carry down the basement stairs (it's heavy!), but it went together easily and quickly. The setup was simple, though the take-a-picture-of-your-bike feature didn't work, so I just measured my bike and set it up like I would any other bike. 

It connected immediately to Zwift on my Mac, no problems, except at first I didn't know to search separately for cadence and power (the controllable interface connected first). I was riding within an hour of starting the assembly. 

My previous setup was a power meter-equipped road bike on a dumb trainer, so some of what seems so great about the KICKR bike might be also true of any smart trainer, but the difference to me is night and day.

The KICKR bike feels like riding on the road in the way momentum carries over when you coast, or cease pedaling just for a few revs, or start up a hill after a descent. On a steep descent it conveys that feeling of carrying a tremendous amount of speed that you get on the road. The way the bike tilts up & down to match grade means your weight distribution is constantly changing on a rolling course, just like on the road.

Over the past year, on any Zwift ride much over an hour, I always watched pro bike racing 
for the second hour on. I've done several 2+ hour ride on the KICKR bike now, and haven't thought about switching on some racing. It's just way more engaging.

I've got it set up with the same derailleurs and gear ratios as my road bike, and it's amazing how similar the feel is - I've done several outside rides since I've had it. And it's great not to have to take the bike off the trainer, swap wheels, or anything else to be ready to ride outside.

It's very quiet, quieter than my road bike on the fluid trainer for sure, but not silent. You can hear the turbine/flywheel revving, and there is an audible resonance when you hit a cadence of about 105, at least for the first 15 or 20 minutes of a ride. It isn't displeasing - I actually find it useful as a shifting prompt. After about 20 minutes that resonance stops happening. I haven't found any others like it, at least up to around 140 RPM. 

I find myself really looking forward to riding each day, and to doing essentially all base miles on it over the next few months.
reviews.title: KICKR Bike - fantastic!

reviews.content: Before I purchased the Wahoo bike I checked customer ratings and they were all extremely positive. I had no idea the bike would be as good as it was. I can't tell you how pleased I am with this purchase. I had everything up and running within 30 minutes and that included unboxing the bike. I was very impressed with the extra quality to detail that wahoo put into their product. I use to dread the days I had to train indoors but now I am actually looking forward to it. Great job Wahoo
reviews.title: AMAZING

reviews.content:
I love the new Kickr bike. I had a Wahoo Kickr and Climbr before, which I loved. It was a hassle to remove the bike on and off constantly. 
This bike is ready to go whenever it's time to ride. It's been raining in Southern California a lot the last couple weeks and to be able to still get that 3 hour ride in was amazing. So comfortable and realistic when connect to Zwift. My coach sets the workout on Zwift and the Kickr bike does the rest. With a little power from you of course. Totally recommend this product!
reviews.title: Amazing and ready to ride!

reviews.content:
Overall I like the Kickr Bike Shift. It is easy to set-up and adjust your position to dial in the fit. It is easy to pair and set-up your drivetrain options. It is nearly silent when riding it. It is fun to ride on Zwift and other training platforms.

I am still getting used to the shifting. Some of it’s me getting used to the buttons but also the feel (kind of has a dead/lose feel after shifts).

I said nearly silent. It is, although periodically I will feel something rubbing, dragging, or grabbing. It feels like it could be the bottom bracket or drivetrain. I need to investigate it but have not had the time yet.

The worst part is the seat clamp. The fastener for the clamp is cheap with subpar threads. I had to take it apart and use a wire brush to clean out the threads from the metallic debris and lube the fastener threads to be able to tighten it. I tried tightening the clamp via the hex head, but could not tighten it enough for the seat post not to slip. I finally found (bought) some friction paste for carbon seat posts and put that on the seat post. It used to slip on every ride now it doesn’t. This is known flaw of the Kickr Bike gen I and now gen II. Seems like Wahoo would have fixed it by now, but nope.

I would have given 5 stars, but with the subpar seat post situation and whatever that rubbing feeling is, I think 4 is fair.
reviews.title: Good bike, lots of adjustability

reviews.content: Very smooth operation. Feels just like a real bike. My only issue is the seat and handlebars do not clamp very secure. No matter how hard I tighten down both the seat and handlebars, they always loosen up and do not hold the position, and end up sliding down. I might have excpected this issue after years of use, but its happening on every ride everytime right out of the box, and I have tightened the clasp so hard I can barley close it. Besides that, the ride is super smooth and works excellent with zwift.

reviews.content: Love the climb features and relatively quiet experience. Mine is creaking a lot, so I'll have to to investigate and add grease to clear that up. Adjustments are quick and easy. Shifting and steering work great. Excellent product!

reviews.content:
Super quiet, fully adjustable and easiest connection to multiple apps (Zwift, TrainerRoad, Garmin connect). Three areas of improvement: 

1) The seat post slips. Continuously. Either the seatpost itself or the collar holding it needs an upgrade. Temporary solution is duct tape (yes, seriously). Long term solution is a new seat post.

2) Gear display / indicator would be exceptionally helpful during non-ERG rides
reviews.title: Amazing - Almost perfect!

groupingData.productName: KICKR BIKE SHIFT Indoor Bike Trainer

reviews.content:
Overall I'm very happy with the bike shift and pleased that I purchased it. Good points are it's very quiet and only a slight vibration when compared to my Kickr v5. I live in an apartment and not had any complaints using it like I have with the Kickr v5. Adjustability and ease of use are fantastic, so much better overall than using your bike indoors.
Negative points are ERG mode seems very erratic, hopefully that will be solved with software update. It's completely rigid but rather than buying a rocker plate, I'm using some yoga balance pods underneath to give some movement. I'd also like to configure the gearing to have a straightforward 25 increments for example, like dream drive on the Stages indoor bike or the Zwift One Hub.

reviews.content:
I moved to the Kickr bike from using he Kickr direct drive v 5. Overall its an improvement but the shifting is not. The electronic shifting and resistance on the bike is clunky and does not feel like real shifting at all. Shifting to a higher (harder) gear spikes the resistance WAY up then it adjusts back done over a couple of seconds. 

The "gearing" generally does not feel like a real bike at all.
reviews.title: Satisfied overall but shifting is rough

reviews.content:
Product is great with a couple of defects. 
I found the saddle to be very uncomfortable and had to change it out ( purchase a new saddle for my road bike and used my older saddle on the wahoo). I personally found the handle bar to be somewhat thin ( will install another tape)
Another issue I have is that the power reading is delayed about a 30-45 seconds when I used zwift on my mac. This of course can be an issue with my mac connectivity and not necessarily the bike. (I have not contacted neither wahoo nor zwift to resolve the issue yet) Bike is extremely quiet but it does screech a bit. Overall have been using the bike 3-4 times per week over the past 2 weeks and have had no major issues.
reviews.title: Great Product with minor defects.

reviews.content: Great bike. Be careful when you tighten the bolts at the base of the bike. I rounded out two of the hex bolts when using a torque wrench to get proper adjustment. I believe the metals used are softer than they should be . Will be asking kickr support for replacement bolts . Everything else is fine
reviews.title: Be careful when tightening the base bolts

groupingData.productName: KICKR BIKE SHIFT Indoor Bike Trainer

reviews.content: Very disappointed with this bike , it didn’t work out of the box and I have since seen a few posts with the same issue i had , you could for example get onto Zwift but a warning notice confirmed no cadence no shifting your avatar was static , it seems to be an issue with the connections on the handlebars , why this wasn’t picked up by quality control measures I don’t know, especially when it’s a new model launch , my bike was set up for 4 days from delivery and not working, I raised a number of tickets and got generic answers non of which were related to the kicker bike shift , I returned the bike for a full refund,

It came well packed and was extremely easy to assemble.
The wahoo app makes it a pleasure to ride. My only complaint is there is a firmware update. We have Samsung phones running on 13 and it will not work , which is extremely frustrating. We have to find someone with an Apple phone to make it work. The bike is very smooth and quiet.

reviews.content: Really enjoying it. Still getting used to the difference between a real bike on a Kickr Core or other smart trainer and a dedicated exercise machine, but I think I'll end up preferring it.

reviews.content: I've used a Saris virtual trainer on Zwift with my road bike mounted for a while, but got the KICKR so my wife and I can both use it (I'm 6'3" and she's 5'1"). It is a smoother and more realistic experience as far as simulating momentum and power demands over rolling hills with quick gradient changes. The Saris is fine on steady climbs but exaggerates any small change in grade on 'rollers' so you lose momentum and this makes it harder to anticipate gear changes like you'd make on the road in 'sim' mode - which I prefer to 'erg'. The KICKR nails the experience of spinning into a short, steep climb and maintaining speed. Adjusting the bike for our individual fits is pretty easy (I swap pedal positions too) other than the saddle height which could be smoother. It tends to slip even when partially tightened to align the saddle direction. We replaced the included saddle with one that allows better blood flow for men and women. The handle bars are a disappointment - at this price point, I would expect something more comfortable. A flat aero top feels much better when climbing than the quite narrow round tube bars that are included. Overall, I'm very happy with the ride and would give a 'great' rating if the components were closer to what you'd see on a $5K road bike (saddle and bars).
reviews.title: Great ride, easy to fit, some components need upgrades.

reviews.content: The bike is very nice. A weird thing happens that the watts are initially higher than expected and then as you ride, they decrease well below my norm with my effort remaining the same. Any suggestions for settings or adjustments would be appreciated.
reviews.title: The bike is very nice.

watts.name: watts
watts.sentence: A weird thing happens that the watts are initially higher than expected and then as you ride, they decrease well below my norm with my effort remaining the same.

reviews.content: Everything was fine until we came to the installation of the pedals. There were no pedals in the box, and yet the instruction manual (p. 10) implies that they were included. I phoned Wahoo to inquire and was told that they used to be included but are no more. That was a big drag, and I had to go to a bike store and buy pedals. People who order a KICKR bike on the Web should be told up front that pedals are not included. That is self-evident, so please modify your Website ASAP. Another possibility would be to give the option of purchasing pedals with the bike, for an extra fee. But just having the box arrive without pedals but implying in the instructions that they were included is very annoying.

pedals.sentence: People who order a KICKR bike on the Web should be told up front that pedals are not included.

drag.sentence: That was a big drag, and I had to go to a bike store and buy pedals.

reviews.content: I have had the Kickr bike for about three weeks. Some learning curves but for the most part I like the smoothness, gear changing and the numbers (watts, speed and mileage) seem to be comparable to my outside riding. I find it much easier than hooking up my road bike.
